TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/MdiHelpButton extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the **Help** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiHelpButton class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **Help** button of an MDI child window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiHelpButton.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiHelpButton1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#407](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_55_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#407](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_55_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Help** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Help** button of an MDI child window in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiHelpButton4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#410](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/592c7524-32ea-4497-94be-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#410](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/592c7524-32ea-4497-94be-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Help** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Help** button of an MDI child window in the hot state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiHelpButton2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Help** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the normal state.

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **Help** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **Help** button of an MDI child window in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form.
